title: HOW TO GROW YOUR OWN ORGANIC VEGETABLES AND HERBS AT HOME PART 1

tasks.task: Construct a simple vegetable box for starting seeds.
subtasks: Gather materials: 7 redwood fence boards, 1 cedar fence runner (2x4), nails, soaker hose, wire, and organic soil.
Cut the fence boards to create the sides of the box (each board cut to 6 feet minus the dog ear, which is removed to make a 6-foot length).
Arrange the fence boards into a rectangular box, with the dog-ear-cut boards used for the ends.
Install the soaker hose (a 20-foot spool cut to the length needed for each plant line) under the wire frame, suspended above the soil surface.
Use wire to secure the soaker hose in place, attaching it to the fence board edges with nails for tension.
Prepare the organic soil by adding food waste at the bottom of the box for composting.
Sow seeds densely according to their germination rates and plant spacing needs.

tasks.task: Compost food waste in the vegetable box.
subtasks: Collect food scraps (e.g., avocado husks, banana peels) from meal preparation.
Lay the food waste at the bottom of the box before adding the organic soil.
Allow the food waste to decompose, releasing nutrients into the soil over time.

tasks.task: Water the seedlings using a soaker hose system.
subtasks: Turn on the soaker hose to deliver water directly to the plant roots.
Monitor water delivery to ensure consistency and adjust wire support if necessary to protect seedlings from hose interference.
